_metadata.description: Central medication database for Neuro Plans - single source of truth for all medication data
_metadata.safetyNotice: This database is for clinical decision support only. Always verify dosing against current prescribing information and institutional protocols.

medication.name: Display name
patientCounseling: Key counseling points

gabapentin.name: Gabapentin
mechanisms: Binds alpha-2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels

neuropathic-pain.indication: Neuropathic pain (diabetic neuropathy, post-herpetic neuralgia, small fiber neuropathy)
neuropathic-pain.titration: Increase by 300 mg every 1-3 days as tolerated
neuropathic-pain.notes: First-line for neuropathic pain; full effect may take 2-4 weeks

epilepsy.notes: Adjunctive only; monotherapy not FDA-approved for epilepsy

migraine-prophylaxis.notes: Off-label; moderate evidence; may help with sleep

precautions: Respiratory depression risk when combined with CNS depressants or opioids
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS)
Dizziness and somnolence - fall risk in elderly
Abuse potential (Schedule V in some states)

drugInteractions.effect: Reduced gabapentin absorption - separate by 2 hours

safety.lactation: Compatible with breastfeeding (low levels in milk)

hepaticAdjustment.notes: No adjustment needed - not hepatically metabolized

monitoring.frequency: Renal function annually or more often if changing

patientCounseling: Do not stop abruptly - taper over 1 week minimum to avoid withdrawal/seizures
May cause drowsiness - avoid driving until effects known
Takes 2-4 weeks to reach full effect for pain
Take with or without food
Report mood changes, suicidal thoughts, or rash immediately

pregabalin.name: Pregabalin
mechanisms: Binds alpha-2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels

neuropathic-pain.indication: Neuropathic pain (diabetic neuropathy, post-herpetic neuralgia, small fiber neuropathy)
neuropathic-pain.titration: May increase to 150 mg BID after 1 week, then to 300 mg BID after another week
neuropathic-pain.notes: First-line for neuropathic pain; faster onset than gabapentin

fibromyalgia.titration: May increase to 150 mg BID within 1 week; max 225 mg BID

epilepsy.titration: Increase based on response and tolerability

precautions: Respiratory depression risk when combined with CNS depressants or opioids
Schedule V controlled substance - abuse potential

drugInteractions.effect: Increased peripheral edema and weight gain

tiers.adjustment: 25-75 mg daily; supplemental dose after dialysis

hepaticAdjustment.notes: No adjustment needed - not hepatically metabolized

monitoring.frequency: Renal function annually or with changes

patientCounseling: Do not stop abruptly - taper over 1 week minimum
Controlled substance - take only as prescribed
May cause drowsiness, weight gain, swelling
Report mood changes, swelling of face/tongue, or difficulty breathing immediately

duloxetine.name: Duloxetine
mechanisms: Inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine

neuropathic-pain.titration: Start 30 mg daily x 1-2 weeks, then increase to 60 mg daily

fibromyalgia.titration: Start 30 mg daily x 1 week, then increase to 60 mg daily
fibromyalgia.notes: FDA-approved; doses above 60 mg show no additional benefit for fibromyalgia

depression-anxiety.indication: Major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder
depression-anxiety.notes: Dual benefit when comorbid depression/anxiety with chronic pain

blackBoxWarnings: Suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults with MDD and other psychiatric disorders
contraindications: Concomitant use with linezolid or IV methylene blue
precautions: Serotonin syndrome risk with serotonergic drugs
Increased bleeding risk especially with anticoagulants/NSAIDs

drugInteractions.effect: Serotonin syndrome risk, seizure threshold lowered

hepaticAdjustment.notes: Avoid in severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh C). Use caution in moderate impairment. Monitor LFTs.

monitoring.frequency: Blood pressure at each visit initially; LFTs PRN

patientCounseling: Do not stop abruptly - taper over 2+ weeks to avoid discontinuation syndrome
May take 2-4 weeks for full pain relief; 4-6 weeks for antidepressant effect
Take with food to minimize nausea
Avoid alcohol
Report unusual bleeding, mood changes, or allergic reactions
Swallow capsule whole - do not crush or chew

amitriptyline.name: Amitriptyline
mechanisms: Inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine

neuropathic-pain.titration: Increase by 10-25 mg every 1-2 weeks as tolerated
neuropathic-pain.notes: First-line TCA for neuropathic pain; sedation limits titration

migraine-prophylaxis.notes: First-line for migraine prophylaxis; helps with comorbid insomnia

blackBoxWarnings: Suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults with MDD
contraindications: Acute recovery phase after myocardial infarction
precautions: Cardiac arrhythmias - ECG before starting in patients with cardiac history
Anticholinergic effects (dry mouth, constipation, urinary retention, blurred vision)
Orthostatic hypotension - fall risk in elderly
AVOID in elderly (Beers Criteria - highly anticholinergic)

tiers.adjustment: Use with caution; active metabolites may accumulate

hepaticAdjustment.notes: Use lower doses; hepatically metabolized. Avoid in severe impairment.

baseline: ECG if cardiac history or age >50
Consider baseline cognitive assessment in elderly

patientCounseling: Take at bedtime due to sedation
Do not stop abruptly - taper over 2+ weeks
Avoid alcohol
May cause dry mouth - sip water, sugar-free gum
Rise slowly to prevent dizziness
Full effect may take 4-6 weeks
Avoid in very hot weather (impaired sweating)

carbamazepine.name: Carbamazepine

epilepsy.notes: First-line for focal epilepsy; induces own metabolism (autoinduction)

neuropathic-pain.notes: Consider for lancinating/shooting pain; many drug interactions

blackBoxWarnings: Serious dermatologic reactions (SJS/TEN) - HLA-B*1502 screening required in Asian populations
Aplastic anemia and agranulocytosis (rare but serious)
precautions: Potent CYP3A4 inducer - many drug interactions
Autoinduction - levels decrease over first 2-4 weeks

drugInteractions.effect: Reduced contraceptive efficacy - use backup method
Reduced valproate levels; increased carbamazepine epoxide

safety.lactation: Compatible but monitor infant for sedation

tiers.adjustment: 75% of normal dose; use with caution

hepaticAdjustment.notes: Reduce dose in hepatic impairment; hepatically metabolized. Avoid in severe impairment.

monitoring.frequency: CBC and sodium monthly x 3 months, then every 3-6 months

patientCounseling: Take with food to reduce GI upset
Report any rash, fever, sore throat, mouth ulcers immediately (stop drug if rash)
Do not stop abruptly - seizure risk
Many drug interactions - inform all providers
May reduce effectiveness of birth control pills
Avoid grapefruit juice

propranolol.name: Propranolol
mechanisms: Blocks beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors

essential-tremor.notes: First-line for essential tremor; 50-70% response rate

migraine-prophylaxis.startingDose: 40 mg BID or 80 mg LA daily
migraine-prophylaxis.notes: First-line for migraine prophylaxis; Level A evidence

akathisia.titration: Increase as needed for symptom control

blackBoxWarnings: Do not discontinue abruptly - risk of exacerbation of angina, MI, or arrhythmia
contraindications: Sinus bradycardia, heart block greater than first degree
precautions: May mask hypoglycemia symptoms in diabetics
Use with caution in hepatic impairment

drugInteractions.effect: Risk of severe bradycardia and heart block
Rebound hypertension if clonidine stopped first

hepaticAdjustment.notes: Reduce dose by 50% in hepatic impairment; extensive first-pass metabolism

patientCounseling: Do not stop abruptly - taper over 1-2 weeks
May cause fatigue, especially initially
Take pulse - notify if <50 bpm
Diabetics: may mask hypoglycemia symptoms
May worsen asthma - use with extreme caution

levetiracetam.name: Levetiracetam

epilepsy-partial.titration: May increase by 500 mg BID every 2 weeks
epilepsy-partial.notes: First-line for focal epilepsy; no titration required but may help tolerability

epilepsy-generalized.titration: Increase by 500 mg BID every 2 weeks
epilepsy-generalized.notes: Effective for JME; good for mixed seizure types

doseOptions.text: 1500 mg IV load then 1000 mg IV q12h
doseOptions.orderSentence: Levetiracetam 1500 mg IV load then 1000 mg IV q12h

seizure-prophylaxis-acute.notes: Duration typically 7 days post-TBI; IV=PO bioequivalent

precautions: Behavioral/psychiatric adverse events (irritability, aggression, anxiety, depression)

monitoring.frequency: Renal function annually; behavioral assessment at each visit

patientCounseling: Report mood changes, irritability, aggression, depression, or suicidal thoughts immediately
May cause drowsiness - avoid driving until effects known
Do not stop abruptly - may precipitate seizures
Keppra Rage is real - discuss with provider if mood changes
Pyridoxine (B6) may help with irritability

sumatriptan.name: Sumatriptan

doseOptions.orderSentence: Sumatriptan 20 mg nasal spray PRN migraine

migraine-acute.startingDose: 50 mg PO (or 6 mg SC for faster relief)
migraine-acute.maxDose: 200 mg PO/day; 12 mg SC/day; 40 mg nasal/day
migraine-acute.notes: Take at onset of headache; may repeat in 2 hours if needed; SC fastest onset

doseOptions.orderSentence: Sumatriptan 6 mg SC PRN cluster headache
Sumatriptan 20 mg nasal spray PRN cluster headache

cluster-headache-acute.notes: SC or nasal preferred over oral for cluster headache due to faster onset

contraindications: History of coronary artery disease, MI, Prinzmetal angina
Use within 24 hours of another triptan or ergot
precautions: Cardiovascular evaluation before use in patients with risk factors
Serotonin syndrome with SSRIs/SNRIs (rare but possible)
Medication overuse headache with frequent use (>10 days/month)

drugInteractions.effect: Increased sumatriptan levels - avoid within 2 weeks

safety.lactation: Compatible - express and discard milk for 12 hours if concerned

hepaticAdjustment.notes: Max 50 mg PO in mild-moderate impairment; contraindicated in severe impairment

monitoring.frequency: At each visit; limit to <10 days/month to prevent MOH

patientCounseling: Take at first sign of migraine headache (not during aura)
May repeat in 2 hours if needed; max 2 doses/day
Do not use more than 10 days per month (medication overuse headache risk)
Chest tightness is common and usually benign - but report if severe or persistent
Do not use if you have heart disease or uncontrolled blood pressure
Store injectable away from light

prednisone.name: Prednisone

doseOptions.orderSentence: Methylprednisolone 1000 mg IV daily x3-5 days
Prednisone 1250 mg PO daily x3-5 days

ms-acute-relapse.startingDose: 1000 mg IV methylprednisolone (or 1250 mg PO prednisone equivalent)
ms-acute-relapse.titration: No taper needed for short courses
ms-acute-relapse.notes: High-dose steroids speed recovery from relapse but don't affect long-term disability

myasthenia-gravis.startingDose: 10-20 mg daily (or low-dose escalation to avoid exacerbation)
myasthenia-gravis.titration: Increase by 10 mg every 3-5 days OR start high and taper; risk of transient worsening
myasthenia-gravis.notes: May cause transient worsening in first 2-3 weeks; inpatient initiation may be safer

inflammatory-neuropathy.titration: Treat for 2-4 weeks then taper over months
inflammatory-neuropathy.notes: For CIDP, IVIG often preferred first-line; steroids for refractory cases or vasculitis

doseOptions.text: 60 mg daily x7 days then taper
doseOptions.orderSentence: Prednisone 60 mg PO daily x7 days then taper
Prednisone 50 mg PO daily x10 days

bells-palsy.titration: 7-10 day course; can taper over 5 days or stop
bells-palsy.notes: Start within 72 hours of onset for best effect

precautions: Hyperglycemia - monitor blood glucose in diabetics
Adrenal suppression with prolonged use - taper required
GI bleeding risk - consider PPI if risk factors
Cataracts and glaucoma with prolonged use

drugInteractions.effect: Variable effect on INR - monitor closely

safety.pregnancyCategory: C (D in first trimester at high doses)

hepaticAdjustment.notes: No adjustment typically needed; prednisone is prodrug converted to prednisolone

monitoring.frequency: Glucose frequently during high-dose; BP at each visit

patientCounseling: Take with food to reduce stomach upset
Do not stop abruptly if on >7-10 days - must taper
May cause insomnia - take in morning
Monitor blood sugar if diabetic
Report signs of infection, GI bleeding, or mood changes
Consider calcium/vitamin D supplementation if prolonged use

pyridostigmine.name: Pyridostigmine

myasthenia-gravis.titration: Increase by 30-60 mg per dose every 3-7 days as needed
myasthenia-gravis.notes: Symptomatic only - does not modify disease; use lowest effective dose

myasthenia-gravis-severe.titration: N/A - use for NPO patients only
myasthenia-gravis-severe.notes: IV dose is 1/30 of oral dose; use only when oral not possible

orthostatic-hypotension.notes: Off-label; augments ganglionic transmission without supine hypertension

precautions: Cholinergic crisis with overdose (excessive secretions, bradycardia, weakness)
Distinguish myasthenic crisis from cholinergic crisis

patientCounseling: Take 30-60 minutes before meals
Dose before activities requiring strength
Report excessive salivation, sweating, diarrhea, or worsening weakness
Carry medical ID indicating myasthenia gravis
Do not take more than prescribed - overdose can worsen weakness

baclofen.name: Baclofen

spasticity.indication: Spasticity (MS, spinal cord injury, cerebral palsy, stroke)
spasticity.maxDose: 80 mg/day (20 mg QID); rarely up to 120 mg in select patients
spasticity.titration: Increase by 5 mg TID every 3 days
spasticity.notes: First-line for spasticity; gradual titration reduces sedation

trigeminal-neuralgia.notes: Second-line; may be used with carbamazepine

hiccups.notes: Off-label; evidence limited but commonly used

blackBoxWarnings: Abrupt discontinuation can cause serious withdrawal (hallucinations, seizures, hyperthermia, death)

tiers.adjustment: Use with caution; may need dose reduction

ongoing: Signs of withdrawal if dose changed

patientCounseling: NEVER stop taking suddenly - can cause seizures and hallucinations
Report increased weakness, sedation, or dizziness
May impair driving - avoid until effects known
Avoid alcohol
Always have a supply - do not run out
